abstract.text: Options for choosing the partition mode that the tessellator applies when deriving
the number and spacing of segments for subdividing a corresponding edge.

inlineContent.text: The table lists the tessellation factor range for each partitioning mode.
Partitioning mode
Tessellation factor range

The floating-point tessellation level is always clamped to its corresponding range before calculating the final tessellation factor. After clamping, the calculation depends on the chosen partitioning mode:
For the
partitioning mode, the result is rounded up to the nearest integer
, where
is a power of two. The corresponding edge is divided into
segments of equal length in (u, v) space.
For the
partitioning mode, the result is rounded up to the nearest integer
. The corresponding edge is divided into
segments of equal length in (u, v) space.
For the
partitioning mode, the tessellation level is rounded up the the nearest odd integer

is
, the edge is not subdivided. Otherwise, the corresponding edge is divided into

segments of equal length, and two additional segments of equal length that are typically shorter than the other segments. The length of the two additional segments relative to the others decreases monotonically by the value of
, where
is the clamped floating-point tessellation level. If

the additional segments equal length to the other segments. As
approaches
, the relative length of the additional segments approaches

. The two additional segments should be placed symmetrically on opposite sides of the subdivided edge. The relative location of these two segments is undefined, but must be identical for any pair of subdivided edges with identical values of
For the
partitioning mode, the tessellation level is rounded up the the nearest even integer

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A Boolean value that determines whether the pipeline scales the tessellation factor.
The maximum tessellation factor that the tessellator uses when tessellating patches.
The size of the control point indices in a control point index buffer.
The format of the tessellation factors in the tessellation factor buffer.
The step function for determining the tessellation factors for a patch from the tessellation factor buffer.
The winding order of triangles from the tessellator.
The partitioning mode that the tessellator uses to derive the number and spacing of segments for subdividing a corresponding edge.
Options for specifying the size of the control point indices in a control point index buffer.
Options for specifying the format of the tessellation factors in a tessellation factor buffer.
Options for specifying the step function that determines the tessellation factors for a patch from the tessellation factor buffer.
Options for choosing the partition mode that the tessellator applies when deriving
the number and spacing of segments for subdividing a corresponding edge.
A fractional even partitioning mode.
A fractional odd partitioning mode.
An integer partitioning mode.
A power of two partitioning mode.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
